reviewText:
Available in many collections "Kid Auto Races" is famous for only one reason - the first short featuring Chaplin in his iconic tramp outfit. There is no plot; obstensively a documentary of a soap box derby, Chaplin's character just follows the camera around and trys to get in frame.

The end.

One Keystone short for this price? Let me know if you're going to buy it - I'll sell you a single Cheerio, which is largely regarded as one of the top 100 breakfast cereals of all time, and will bring back breakfast cereals as an artform.
